steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the content bottleneck
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most content leaders don't say out loud:

Simple updates require dev tickets. Campaign launches wait for IT resources. And by the time your content goes live, the moment's passed.

That's not a content problem. That's a process problem.

We specialize in unbottlenecking content pipelines so your team can launch independently.

How many dev tickets does {COMPANY}'s content team submit per week?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the ticket queue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how many developer tickets does your content team submit per week?

If the answer is "too many," you're not alone. Most Optimizely teams are bottlenecked by IT dependencies for updates that should be self-service.

We help content teams reclaim control without breaking governance.

Want me to send over a content independence checklist? Takes 10 minutes to score your current state.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - missed windows
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how many campaigns have launched late because content updates got stuck in the dev queue?

Market windows don't wait. Your competitors with faster content operations are capturing the opportunities you're missing.

We've helped content teams cut their IT dependency dramatically.

What's the average turnaround time for a simple content update at {COMPANY} right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the experimentation paradox
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, you're sitting on the world's best experimentation platform.

But if your team lacks the process to move from theory to execution, that capability is just potential energy. Untapped. Unmeasured.

We've launched high-velocity experimentation programs that deliver measurable conversion and revenue lifts.

How many A/B tests did {COMPANY} run last quarter?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - from theory to tests
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, most marketing teams know they should be running more experiments.

The problem isn't belief. It's execution. Building the process, training the team, sustaining velocity.

We've helped Optimizely users go from ad-hoc testing to systematic experimentation programs.

If I sent over our experimentation readiness scorecard, would you take 15 minutes to benchmark {COMPANY}?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - untested revenue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, every page, flow, and experience you haven't tested is revenue you haven't optimized.

The data's clear: teams that experiment systematically outperform those that guess.

You have the platform. The question is whether you have the process.

What's stopping {COMPANY} from running more experiments right now—resources, process, or something else?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - your Opal credits
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most Optimizely users don't realize:

You have Opal AI credits sitting unused every month. Features that could transform your content operations—untouched.

The top 1% of users engage with Opal nearly 200 times. Most barely scratch the surface.

We help content teams activate Opal with the right foundation.

How many Opal AI actions did {COMPANY} run last month—ballpark?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI without a foundation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, there's pressure to adopt AI for personalization. But without a solid content foundation, you risk investing in technology that delivers no measurable results.

AI is only as good as what it's built on.

We help content teams activate Optimizely's AI features with the right prerequisites in place.

What's {COMPANY}'s biggest blocker to getting more value from Opal right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI beyond the buzzword
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, everyone's talking about AI. Few are extracting real value.

The difference? A content strategy that makes AI actionable, not just aspirational.

We've helped content teams turn Opal from feature to revenue driver.

Want me to send over our Opal activation checklist? Shows the 5 prerequisites most teams miss.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 60-90 days
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when ACCO Brands needed to launch new brand sites, the industry standard was 6-9 months.

We got them live in 60-90 days.

Same platform. Different approach. The result? They stopped losing to more agile competitors.

How long does it typically take {COMPANY} to launch a new site or major campaign?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the agility gap
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, while you're planning your next campaign launch, your competitors are already live with theirs.

That's not a talent gap. It's an operations gap. And it compounds over time.

We've helped content teams cut their time-to-market dramatically.

What's slowing {COMPANY} down most—approvals, dev resources, or content production?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 260% AOV surge
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, ACCO Brands achieved a 260% surge in AOV after we unified their content and commerce across 20+ brands.

That's not incremental improvement. That's transformation.

The approach? A unified content strategy that eliminated friction and scaled.

If I showed you the exact framework we used, would it be relevant to {COMPANY}'s situation?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: Re: re: {FIRST_NAME} - the content bottleneck
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, following up on this.

If your content team is no longer bottlenecked by IT, tell me and I'll close the loop.

But if simple updates still require dev tickets—I can have a content independence audit ready for {COMPANY} in 48 hours.

{FIRST_NAME}, every page, flow, and experience you haven't tested is revenue you haven't optimized.

The data's clear: teams that experiment systematically outperform those that guess.

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - your Opal credits
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most Optimizely users don't realize:

You have Opal AI credits sitting unused every month. Features that could transform your content operations—untouched.

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI without a foundation

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI beyond the buzzword
steps.body:

Want me to send over our Opal activation checklist? Shows the 5 prerequisites most teams miss.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 60-90 days

How long does it typically take {COMPANY} to launch a new site or major campaign?

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the agility gap
steps.body:

We've helped content teams cut their time-to-market dramatically.

What's slowing {COMPANY} down most—approvals, dev resources, or content production?

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the 80% problem
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we're the Optimizely Partner of the year 2024. 


You've spent 6 figures to implement the platform, and now it's just a headache.


You've got the marketing team banging at your door daily, asking for features.


If we could do a complimentary audit of your current setup and deal with those backlogs for you, would that be worth 30-mins?



{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the ROI question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when leadership asks about ROI on your Optimizely purchcase, what do you tell them?


If you're using 20 percent of the platform's capabilities, the honest answer is uncomfortable. You're paying for value you're not extracting.


We helped Old National Bank benchmark their actual usage and unlock features they didn't know existed.


If I sent over a complimentary audit framework from Optimizely's Partner of the Year, would you take 15 minutes to see where {COMPANY} stands?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the blind spot
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here is  the pattern we see with Optimizely teams:


They know they're underutilizing the platform. They just don't know what they're missing.


No one's mapped feature usage against what's available. So the capabilities that could transform your digital operations sit there, untouched.


We've built an adoption audit that reveals the gaps in under 30 minutes.


Which Optimizely feature do you suspect {COMPANY} should be using but isn't?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the compliance clock
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if {COMPANY}'s running an older Optimizely version, you're likely carrying security vulnerabilities that create regulatory exposure every day you delay.


Not a scare tactic. Just what happens when platforms age faster than upgrade cycles.


We've architected migration paths for enterprises that need to move without disrupting operations.


Can I send you a 5-point security checklist we use with regulated clients? Takes 10 minutes to look yourself.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we took City of Gresham from 60 percent to over 90 percent WCAG AA compliance—and they've continued it for 10+ years.


Most organizations chase compliance reactively. Constant fire drills. Last-minute scrambles before audits.


There's a better model: proactive compliance built into your platform operations.


Where does {COMPANY} currently sit on WCAG compliance—reactive mode or proactive?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - audit season
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when the auditors come knocking, how confident are you in your platform's compliance posture?


Our SOC II certification combined with Optimizely's ISO27001 provides the assurance regulated industries need.


We've hlped continue compliance for government and financial services clients for over a decade.


If I shared our compliance audit checklist, would it be useful for {COMPANY}'s next review cycle?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the CMS 12 conversation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, your CMS 12 upgrade involves major .NET changes that tend to create two problems:

Downtime you didn't budget for. And friction between IT and Marketing you didn't expect.

Our 10+ specialized Optimizely developers have managed 125+ upgrades. The common thread? Planning that prevents the drama.

What's the biggest concern you have about {COMPANY}'s upgrade timeline?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 125 upgrades later
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we've done 125+ Optimizely upgrades.

Here's what we've learned: the teams that struggle aren't under-skilled. They're under-prepared. They don't have a migration path that accounts for their specific integrations, content structure, and stakeholder dynamics.

We've built a pre-upgrade readiness assessment that catches the issues before they become problems.

Should I send it over? Takes about 20 minutes to complete.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the upgrade friction
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, platform upgrades have a way of surfacing tension between IT and Marketing.

IT wants stability. Marketing wants speed. And somewhere in the middle, your upgrade timeline gets caught.

We've learned how to navigate both stakeholders during 125+ Optimizely upgrades.

How aligned are IT and Marketing at {COMPANY} on the upgrade timeline right now—scale of 1-10?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.body:

steps.body:

If you're around for 15 minutes this week, I'll show you:

- Your estimated current spend vs. what it could be

- The 3 highest-ROI automation areas for your team

- Your payback timeline (Cydome's was under 2 months)


You'll walk away with a ROI breakdown.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - If we don't deliver more value than our project fee, we return the difference

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AS400 dependency
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if your AS400 goes down, does production stop?


We help manufacturers modernize faster to reduce that risk.


What percentage of {COMPANY}'s production depends on the AS400?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - single point of failure
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, many manufacturers depend on AS400 systems for production. If it goes down, the line stops.


The longer you run legacy systems, the higher the risk. Aging hardware. Scarce talent. Growing complexity.


We help manufacturers modernize faster with AI-enabled approaches. 2x faster rewrite timelines. Reduce risk by getting to modern systems sooner.


How many hours of downtime can {COMPANY} afford if the AS400 fails?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - criticality question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how critical is your AS400 to daily production?


Asking because manufacturers with high AS400 dependency often prioritize modernization to reduce risk. We help make that happen faster.


Would you describe {COMPANY}'s AS400 dependency as low, medium, or critical?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the risk equation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, the longer you run an AS400, the higher the risk. Hardware ages. Talent gets scarcer. Knowledge erodes.


For manufacturers where AS400 = production, this is a business continuity issue.


Modernization is the answer. We make it happen 2x faster with AI-enabled approaches.


What's {COMPANY}'s current plan if the AS400 fails—manual workaround, backup system, or nothing?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: Re: re: {FIRST_NAME} - AS400 dependency
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, following up on production system risk.


If {COMPANY}'s AS400 is stable and well-supported, tell me and I'll close the loop.


But if you're concerned about long-term risk—I can send our modernization acceleration framework.


Which is it—close the loop or send the framework?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}- ERP blocker
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, is your AS400 blocking ERP integration?


We help manufacturers modernize legacy systems to enable modern architectures.


How many systems at {COMPANY} need data from the AS400 but can't get it easily?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the integration tax
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, modern manufacturing runs on integrated systems. ERP. MES. Supply chain. All connected.


But AS400s were built before integration was a priority. They create data silos and manual processes.


We help manufacturers modernize AS400 systems with AI-enabled approaches. Clear path from legacy to connected architecture.


What's {COMPANY}'s biggest integration pain point—ERP, supply chain, or customer systems?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - integration question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, what's the biggest challenge connecting your AS400 to modern systems like ERP?


Asking because integration issues are common. We help manufacturers create a path from legacy RPG to modern architectures.


Would you say the blocker is technical limitations, budget constraints, or resource availability?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: Re: re: {FIRST_NAME} - ERP blocker
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, following up on AS400 integration.


If {COMPANY}'s systems talk to each other well, tell me and I'll close the loop.


But if data silos and manual processes are slowing you down—I can send our integration path framework.


Which is it—close the loop or send the framework?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the manual tax
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, manufacturers tell me the same thing: AS400 does its job, but it's an island.


Can't connect to ERP. Can't integrate with supply chain systems. Data moves manually.


Modernization fixes this. We make it happen faster with AI-enabled approaches.


How many hours per week does {COMPANY} spend manually moving data out of the AS400?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - RPG knowledge
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, quick question - does anyone at {COMPANY} still understand your RPG code?


We use AI to document legacy systems 50% faster than manual approaches.


How many employees can actually modify {COMPANY}'s AS400 today?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - knowledge erosion
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, manufacturers running AS400 systems often face a knowledge problem: the RPG developers who built the system are gone. Documentation is incomplete.


This makes maintenance risky and modernization slow. You can't change what you don't understand.


Our AI agents document RPG code 50% faster than manual approaches. Foundation for any maintenance or modernization.


How many years until {COMPANY}'s last AS400 expert retires?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - knowledge check
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how much institutional knowledge about your AS400 system exists only in people's heads?


Asking because we help manufacturers capture this knowledge with AI-enabled documentation. 50% faster than manual approaches.


Would you say {COMPANY}'s AS400 knowledge is documented, partially documented, or mostly tribal?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: Re: re: {FIRST_NAME} - RPG knowledge
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, following up on AS400 documentation.


If{COMPANY}'s RPG system is well-documented, tell me and I'll close the loop.


But if understanding the code is a challenge—I can send our AI documentation framework.


Which is it—close the loop or send the framework?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the retirement risk
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, the biggest risk with AS400 systems isn't the technology. It's the knowledge.


Original developers retired. Documentation is scattered. Every change carries risk because nobody fully understands the system.


We use AI to solve this. 50 Percent faster documentation, complete system understanding.


On a scale of 1-10, how dependent is {COMPANY} on specific people for AS400 knowledge?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AS400 budget
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, planning an AS400 modernization but not sure what it will cost?


We offer fixed pricing. No hourly billing, no budget surprises.


Has {COMPANY} gotten quotes that vary by more than 50%—yes or no?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the 2-3x problem
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, AS400 modernization budgets are hard to pin down. Traditional consultants quote hourly, then projects go 2-3x over.


We do it differently. Fixed price, scope defined upfront. We're incentivized to finish, not extend.


Clients typically see 15%+ cost reduction vs. traditional approaches.


What's {COMPANY}'s biggest concern with modernization—budget, timeline, or risk?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - budget question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when it comes to AS400 modernization, what's more important: knowing the total cost upfront, or flexibility to change scope?


Asking because we offer fixed pricing—which works great for budget predictability but requires defined scope.


Which matters more to {COMPANY}—predictability or flexibility?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the approval blocker
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, the hardest part of approving an AS400 modernization project is the uncertainty. How much will it really cost? What if it goes over?


Traditional consultants use hourly billing. Budget overruns are common.

steps.subject: FW: {FIRST_NAME}: 15 minutes
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, getting flooded with LawTech vendor emails lately? We help in-house teams make sense of what’s actually out there – what’s working (and what’s not!).


Happy to share what’s working (and what’s not) for teams like {COMPANY}.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. – No pitch, no fee. We’re not a vendor; we help you make sense of the market.

steps.subject: RE: {FIRST_NAME}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, know you should explore LawTech options but can't find the time? Most {COMPANY}-sized firms are juggling too many areas to evaluate the 6,000+ solutions being pitched to them.


We've worked with hundreds of in-house teams to map what's noise vs. what actually makes sense for their situation - happy to share what we're seeing.


Worth 15 minutes?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - We're not selling anything. Just want to help you figure out what (if anything) is worth exploring.

steps.subject: {COMPANY} LawTech Fatigue...
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, spending more time on vendor research than strategic work? Most GCs want to be business advisors, not procurement specialists - but evaluating tech has become another item on an already impossible list. 


We help in-house teams like {COMPANY} and similar firms figure out what LawTech actually fits without the usual pressure.


Worth a brief conversation about what's relevant (and what's not)?


{{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}}


P.S. - No vendor pitch. We work for you, not the software companies.

steps.subject: RE: {COMPANY} Fatigue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, getting flooded with LawTech vendor emails lately?


Most in-house teams at {COMPANY}-sized firms waste hours sorting through 6,000+ solutions. If you're around for 15 minutes this week, we'll show you:


- Which 5-10 LawTech tools actually make sense for your team size and workflow

- What's working (and flopping) for similar in-house teams in {INDUSTRY}

- Red flags to stay away from when vendors pitch you


You'll walk away with a clear market map whether we work together or not.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - No pitch, no fee. Just 15 minutes to cut through the noise.

steps.subject: Sick of LawTech pitches {FIRST_NAME}?
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, drowning in LawTech vendor pitches?


You don't have time to evaluate 6,000 solutions while juggling corporate, employment, contracts, and everything else. If you're around for 15 minutes next week, we'll show you:


- The 3 most common vendor traps in-house teams fall into (and how to stay away from them)

- What peer companies in {INDUSTRY} are actually using (vs. what vendors claim)

- A no-pressure roadmap for evaluating tools when you're ready


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - We're not selling software. We help you figure out what's worth exploring.

{FIRST_NAME}, I noticed from your website you {FIRST LINE}. {That usually means|Typically that signals|In my experience that means} {you're either at capacity or about to be|the caseload is climbing|more cases are coming in than you can staff for}.



We {recently helped|worked with|partnered with} a {35-attorney practice in Houston|mid-sized firm in Denver|litigation group in Atlanta} {add 12 virtual legal staff|bring on 12 remote paralegals and assistants|hire 12 pre-vetted virtual team members} — {case managers, paralegals, intake coordinators|paralegals, case managers, and legal assistants|intake specialists and paralegals}.



{Result|Outcome|What happened}: they {went from 600 to 1,100 active cases|nearly doubled their active matters|scaled from 600 active cases to over 1,000} in {5 months|under 6 months|about 5 months}, {with lower overhead per case|while cutting cost per case|at a lower cost per matter}.



{Open to a quick call|Worth 10 minutes|Would a brief chat help} to see if {this approach fits|similar staffing could work for|this model makes sense for} {COMPANY}?



{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}



P.S. {They specifically credited the intake team with recovering cases they used to lose to slow follow-up|Their intake conversion jumped 35 percent — happy to share how|The intake specialists alone paid for themselves in month one}.

steps.subject: {{Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question, {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|{COMPANY} - question|Re: {COMPANY}}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, {FIRST LINE}.


If we could help {COMPANY} add 2.5M in revenue and scale to 1,000+ cases in 3 months, with month-to-month contracts and no massive hiring, would you be up for a brief conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - We helped a mid-sized law firm in Chicago add 2.5M in revenue while saving 1M annually in just 3 months.

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the content bottleneck
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most content leaders don't say out loud:

Simple updates require dev tickets. Campaign launches wait for IT resources. And by the time your content goes live, the moment's passed.

That's not a content problem. That's a process problem.

We specialize in unbottlenecking content pipelines so your team can launch independently.

How many dev tickets does {COMPANY}'s content team submit per week?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the ticket queue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how many developer tickets does your content team submit per week?

If the answer is "too many," you're not alone. Most Optimizely teams are bottlenecked by IT dependencies for updates that should be self-service.

We help content teams reclaim control without breaking governance.

Want me to send over a content independence checklist? Takes 10 minutes to score your current state.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - missed windows
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how many campaigns have launched late because content updates got stuck in the dev queue?

Market windows don't wait. Your competitors with faster content operations are capturing the opportunities you're missing.

We've helped content teams cut their IT dependency dramatically.

What's the average turnaround time for a simple content update at {COMPANY} right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the experimentation paradox
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, you're sitting on the world's best experimentation platform.

But if your team lacks the process to move from theory to execution, that capability is just potential energy. Untapped. Unmeasured.

We've launched high-velocity experimentation programs that deliver measurable conversion and revenue lifts.

How many A/B tests did {COMPANY} run last quarter?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - from theory to tests
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, most marketing teams know they should be running more experiments.

The problem isn't belief. It's execution. Building the process, training the team, sustaining velocity.

We've helped Optimizely users go from ad-hoc testing to systematic experimentation programs.

If I sent over our experimentation readiness scorecard, would you take 15 minutes to benchmark {COMPANY}?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - untested revenue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, every page, flow, and experience you haven't tested is revenue you haven't optimized.

The data's clear: teams that experiment systematically outperform those that guess.

You have the platform. The question is whether you have the process.

What's stopping {COMPANY} from running more experiments right now—resources, process, or something else?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - your Opal credits
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most Optimizely users don't realize:

You have Opal AI credits sitting unused every month. Features that could transform your content operations—untouched.

The top 1% of users engage with Opal nearly 200 times. Most barely scratch the surface.

We help content teams activate Opal with the right foundation.

How many Opal AI actions did {COMPANY} run last month—ballpark?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI without a foundation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, there's pressure to adopt AI for personalization. But without a solid content foundation, you risk investing in technology that delivers no measurable results.

AI is only as good as what it's built on.

We help content teams activate Optimizely's AI features with the right prerequisites in place.

What's {COMPANY}'s biggest blocker to getting more value from Opal right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI beyond the buzzword
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, everyone's talking about AI. Few are extracting real value.

The difference? A content strategy that makes AI actionable, not just aspirational.

We've helped content teams turn Opal from feature to revenue driver.

Want me to send over our Opal activation checklist? Shows the 5 prerequisites most teams miss.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 60-90 days
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when ACCO Brands needed to launch new brand sites, the industry standard was 6-9 months.

We got them live in 60-90 days.

Same platform. Different approach. The result? They stopped losing to more agile competitors.

How long does it typically take {COMPANY} to launch a new site or major campaign?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the agility gap
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, while you're planning your next campaign launch, your competitors are already live with theirs.

That's not a talent gap. It's an operations gap. And it compounds over time.

We've helped content teams cut their time-to-market dramatically.

What's slowing {COMPANY} down most—approvals, dev resources, or content production?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 260% AOV surge
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, ACCO Brands achieved a 260% surge in AOV after we unified their content and commerce across 20+ brands.

That's not incremental improvement. That's transformation.

The approach? A unified content strategy that eliminated friction and scaled.

If I showed you the exact framework we used, would it be relevant to {COMPANY}'s situation?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: Re: re: {FIRST_NAME} - the content bottleneck
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, following up on this.

If your content team is no longer bottlenecked by IT, tell me and I'll close the loop.

But if simple updates still require dev tickets—I can have a content independence audit ready for {COMPANY} in 48 hours.

Which is it—close the loop or send the audit?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, am I reaching the right person for content operations and experimentation at {COMPANY}?

We help content teams build faster workflows and high-velocity testing programs—complimentary assessment from Optimizely's Partner of the Year.

steps.body:

Either way, let me know so I'm not cluttering your inbox.

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the 80% problem
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we're the Optimizely Partner of the year 2024. 


You've spent 6 figures to implement the platform, and now it's just a headache.


You've got the marketing team banging at your door daily, asking for features.


If we could do a complimentary audit of your current setup and deal with those backlogs for you, would that be worth 30-mins?



{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the ROI question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when leadership asks about ROI on your Optimizely purchcase, what do you tell them?


If you're using 20 percent of the platform's capabilities, the honest answer is uncomfortable. You're paying for value you're not extracting.


We helped Old National Bank benchmark their actual usage and unlock features they didn't know existed.


If I sent over a complimentary audit framework from Optimizely's Partner of the Year, would you take 15 minutes to see where {COMPANY} stands?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the blind spot
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here is  the pattern we see with Optimizely teams:


They know they're underutilizing the platform. They just don't know what they're missing.


No one's mapped feature usage against what's available. So the capabilities that could transform your digital operations sit there, untouched.


We've built an adoption audit that reveals the gaps in under 30 minutes.


Which Optimizely feature do you suspect {COMPANY} should be using but isn't?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the compliance clock
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if {COMPANY}'s running an older Optimizely version, you're likely carrying security vulnerabilities that create regulatory exposure every day you delay.


Not a scare tactic. Just what happens when platforms age faster than upgrade cycles.


We've architected migration paths for enterprises that need to move without disrupting operations.


Can I send you a 5-point security checklist we use with regulated clients? Takes 10 minutes to look yourself.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we took City of Gresham from 60 percent to over 90 percent WCAG AA compliance—and they've continued it for 10+ years.


Most organizations chase compliance reactively. Constant fire drills. Last-minute scrambles before audits.


There's a better model: proactive compliance built into your platform operations.


Where does {COMPANY} currently sit on WCAG compliance—reactive mode or proactive?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - audit season
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when the auditors come knocking, how confident are you in your platform's compliance posture?


Our SOC II certification combined with Optimizely's ISO27001 provides the assurance regulated industries need.


We've hlped continue compliance for government and financial services clients for over a decade.


If I shared our compliance audit checklist, would it be useful for {COMPANY}'s next review cycle?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the CMS 12 conversation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, your CMS 12 upgrade involves major .NET changes that tend to create two problems:

Downtime you didn't budget for. And friction between IT and Marketing you didn't expect.

Our 10+ specialized Optimizely developers have managed 125+ upgrades. The common thread? Planning that prevents the drama.

What's the biggest concern you have about {COMPANY}'s upgrade timeline?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 125 upgrades later
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we've done 125+ Optimizely upgrades.

Here's what we've learned: the teams that struggle aren't under-skilled. They're under-prepared. They don't have a migration path that accounts for their specific integrations, content structure, and stakeholder dynamics.

We've built a pre-upgrade readiness assessment that catches the issues before they become problems.

Should I send it over? Takes about 20 minutes to complete.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the upgrade friction
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, platform upgrades have a way of surfacing tension between IT and Marketing.

IT wants stability. Marketing wants speed. And somewhere in the middle, your upgrade timeline gets caught.

We've learned how to navigate both stakeholders during 125+ Optimizely upgrades.

How aligned are IT and Marketing at {COMPANY} on the upgrade timeline right now—scale of 1-10?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the talent problem
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, certified Optimizely developers are getting harder to find and more expensive to hire.

That creates a dependency problem. You need specialized skills, but building an internal team takes months and costs more than outsourcing.

We have 10+ specialized Optimizely developers on call. No recruitment. No ramp time.

How many Optimizely-certified developers does {COMPANY} currently have in-house?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the contractor cycle
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's the pattern: you hire expensive contractors for Optimizely work. They leave. Knowledge walks out the door.

Then you hire again. Pay for the same ramp time. Hope this one sticks.

We've built a dedicated team of 10+ Optimizely specialists who stay. They know the platform. They know your platform.

Does {COMPANY} currently rely on contractors or in-house for Optimizely work?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the content bottleneck
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most content leaders don't say out loud:

Simple updates require dev tickets. Campaign launches wait for IT resources. And by the time your content goes live, the moment's passed.

That's not a content problem. That's a process problem.

We specialize in unbottlenecking content pipelines so your team can launch independently.

How many dev tickets does {COMPANY}'s content team submit per week?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the ticket queue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how many developer tickets does your content team submit per week?

If the answer is "too many," you're not alone. Most Optimizely teams are bottlenecked by IT dependencies for updates that should be self-service.

We help content teams reclaim control without breaking governance.

Want me to send over a content independence checklist? Takes 10 minutes to score your current state.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - missed windows
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how many campaigns have launched late because content updates got stuck in the dev queue?

Market windows don't wait. Your competitors with faster content operations are capturing the opportunities you're missing.

We've helped content teams cut their IT dependency dramatically.

What's the average turnaround time for a simple content update at {COMPANY} right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the experimentation paradox
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, you're sitting on the world's best experimentation platform.

But if your team lacks the process to move from theory to execution, that capability is just potential energy. Untapped. Unmeasured.

We've launched high-velocity experimentation programs that deliver measurable conversion and revenue lifts.

How many A/B tests did {COMPANY} run last quarter?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - from theory to tests
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, most marketing teams know they should be running more experiments.

The problem isn't belief. It's execution. Building the process, training the team, sustaining velocity.

We've helped Optimizely users go from ad-hoc testing to systematic experimentation programs.

If I sent over our experimentation readiness scorecard, would you take 15 minutes to benchmark {COMPANY}?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - untested revenue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, every page, flow, and experience you haven't tested is revenue you haven't optimized.

The data's clear: teams that experiment systematically outperform those that guess.

You have the platform. The question is whether you have the process.

What's stopping {COMPANY} from running more experiments right now—resources, process, or something else?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - your Opal credits
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most Optimizely users don't realize:

You have Opal AI credits sitting unused every month. Features that could transform your content operations—untouched.

The top 1% of users engage with Opal nearly 200 times. Most barely scratch the surface.

We help content teams activate Opal with the right foundation.

How many Opal AI actions did {COMPANY} run last month—ballpark?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI without a foundation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, there's pressure to adopt AI for personalization. But without a solid content foundation, you risk investing in technology that delivers no measurable results.

AI is only as good as what it's built on.

We help content teams activate Optimizely's AI features with the right prerequisites in place.

What's {COMPANY}'s biggest blocker to getting more value from Opal right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI beyond the buzzword
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, everyone's talking about AI. Few are extracting real value.

The difference? A content strategy that makes AI actionable, not just aspirational.

We've helped content teams turn Opal from feature to revenue driver.

Want me to send over our Opal activation checklist? Shows the 5 prerequisites most teams miss.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 60-90 days
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when ACCO Brands needed to launch new brand sites, the industry standard was 6-9 months.

We got them live in 60-90 days.

Same platform. Different approach. The result? They stopped losing to more agile competitors.

How long does it typically take {COMPANY} to launch a new site or major campaign?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the agility gap
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, while you're planning your next campaign launch, your competitors are already live with theirs.

That's not a talent gap. It's an operations gap. And it compounds over time.

We've helped content teams cut their time-to-market dramatically.

What's slowing {COMPANY} down most—approvals, dev resources, or content production?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

The approach? A unified content strategy that eliminated friction and scaled.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the 80% problem
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most IT leaders suspect but rarely quantify:

80% of your Optimizely features are sitting unused. That's not a guess—it's what the data shows across enterprise software.

The result? ROI justification becomes nearly impossible. And the features you're paying for? Your team doesn't even know they exist.

We run complimentary adoption audits for Optimizely users—takes 30 minutes, shows exactly what's being missed.

What's the biggest capability gap you suspect {COMPANY} has right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the ROI question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when leadership asks about ROI on your Optimizely investment, what do you tell them?

If you're using 20% of the platform's capabilities, the honest answer is uncomfortable. You're paying for value you're not extracting.

We helped Old National Bank benchmark their actual usage and unlock features they didn't know existed.

If I sent over a complimentary audit framework from Optimizely's Partner of the Year, would you take 15 minutes to see where {COMPANY} stands?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the blind spot
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's the pattern we see with Optimizely teams:

They know they're underutilizing the platform. They just don't know what they're missing.

No one's mapped feature usage against what's available. So the capabilities that could transform your digital operations sit there, untouched.

We've built an adoption audit that reveals the gaps in under 30 minutes.

Which Optimizely feature do you suspect {COMPANY} should be using but isn't?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the compliance clock
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if {COMPANY}'s running an older Optimizely version, you're likely carrying security vulnerabilities that create regulatory exposure every day you delay.

Not a scare tactic. Just what happens when platforms age faster than upgrade cycles.

We've architected migration paths for enterprises that need to move without disrupting operations.

Can I send you a 5-point security checklist we use with regulated clients? Takes 10 minutes to score yourself.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 60% to 90%
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we took City of Gresham from 60% to over 90% WCAG AA compliance—and they've maintained it for 10+ years.

Most organizations chase compliance reactively. Constant fire drills. Last-minute scrambles before audits.

There's a better model: proactive compliance built into your platform operations.

Where does {COMPANY} currently sit on WCAG compliance—reactive mode or proactive?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - audit season
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when the auditors come knocking, how confident are you in your platform's compliance posture?

Our SOC II certification combined with Optimizely's ISO27001 provides the assurance regulated industries need.

We've maintained compliance for government and financial services clients for over a decade.

If I shared our compliance audit checklist, would it be useful for {COMPANY}'s next review cycle?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the CMS 12 conversation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, your CMS 12 upgrade involves major .NET changes that tend to create two problems:

Downtime you didn't budget for. And friction between IT and Marketing you didn't expect.

Our 10+ specialized Optimizely developers have managed 125+ upgrades. The common thread? Planning that prevents the drama.

What's the biggest concern you have about {COMPANY}'s upgrade timeline?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 125 upgrades later
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we've done 125+ Optimizely upgrades.

Here's what we've learned: the teams that struggle aren't under-skilled. They're under-prepared. They don't have a migration path that accounts for their specific integrations, content structure, and stakeholder dynamics.

We've built a pre-upgrade readiness assessment that catches the issues before they become problems.

Should I send it over? Takes about 20 minutes to complete.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the upgrade friction
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, platform upgrades have a way of surfacing tension between IT and Marketing.

IT wants stability. Marketing wants speed. And somewhere in the middle, your upgrade timeline gets caught.

We've learned how to navigate both stakeholders during 125+ Optimizely upgrades.

How aligned are IT and Marketing at {COMPANY} on the upgrade timeline right now—scale of 1-10?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, certified Optimizely developers are getting harder to find and more expensive to hire.

That creates a dependency problem. You need specialized skills, but building an internal team takes months and costs more than outsourcing.

We have 10+ specialized Optimizely developers on call. No recruitment. No ramp time.

How many Optimizely-certified developers does {COMPANY} currently have in-house?

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could launch your MVP in 4-6 weeks instead of 6 months, with production-ready architecture from day one, would you be available to a quick conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We've built MVPs for GoDaddy, IBM, and 120+ companies — they launched in weeks, not months, with no rewrites needed after launch.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - content infrastructure at {COMPANY}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME},


For media executives, content is the product. The infrastructure that manages and delivers it either enables competitive advantage or creates operational drag.


Most media companies have accumulated content systems over years - editorial tools, distribution pipelines, platform-specific solutions. Each solved a problem. Together, they create complexity that slows everything down.


Hygraph consolidates that. One content platform serving every distribution channel. Operational efficiency without sacrificing editorial flexibility. Architecture that scales with content growth.


Worth a strategic conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - Happy to share how media companies at your scale have approached this consolidation.

steps.subject: distribution efficiency at {COMPANY}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME},


Multi-platform distribution is table stakes in media. The competitive advantage is how efficiently you execute it.


Most media companies I talk to have significant overhead in content operations - multiple publishing workflows, platform-specific integrations, manual coordination between teams. That overhead is time your competitors might be using differently.


Hygraph addresses this at the infrastructure level. One content layer, every platform, streamlined operations.


If distribution efficiency is on your radar, might be worth discussing.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - The operational efficiency conversation usually resonates at the executive level.

{FIRST_NAME}, what if you could get full-time ops support for 70% less than hiring in the UK?

We provide dedicated specialists—vetted for 12 hours, Culture Index matched—at a fraction of UK salaries.

What's {COMPANY}'s current cost per ops hour when you add salary, benefits, and overhead?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the real cost
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, hiring full-time in the UK is expensive—a decent ops hire runs £50-80k with benefits and overhead. And if they don't work out, you're back to square one.

We work with SaaS companies who need full-time-level support without the full-time cost. Our specialists are dedicated to you (not shared), vetted for 12 hours including Culture Index matching, and cost 70% less than a UK hire.

If it doesn't work, we replace them at no cost. And you can start with 20-hour trial to test the fit.

How many times has {COMPANY} hired for ops and had it not work out?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - hiring question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, quick one—have you looked at what full-time ops support would actually cost at {COMPANY}?

When you add salary, benefits, equipment, management time—a £50k hire often costs £70k+.

What if you could get the same support for 70% less, with a trial period to test the fit?

Is {COMPANY} actively looking to hire ops, considering it, or not thinking about it?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 70% less
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, dedicated ops specialist. 12-hour vetting. 70% less than UK hire. 20-hour trial to try.

What's the main thing stopping {COMPANY} from adding ops capacity—budget, finding the right person, or something else?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: FW: {FIRST_NAME}: 15 minutes
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, getting flooded with LawTech vendor emails lately? We help in-house teams make sense of what’s actually out there – what’s working (and what’s not!).

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. – No pitch, no fee. We’re not a vendor; we help you make sense of the market.

steps.subject: RE: {FIRST_NAME}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, know you should explore LawTech options but can't find the time? Most {COMPANY}-sized firms are juggling too many areas to evaluate the 6,000+ solutions being pitched to them.


We've worked with hundreds of in-house teams to map what's noise vs. what actually makes sense for their situation - happy to share what we're seeing.


Worth 15 minutes?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - We're not selling anything. Just want to help you figure out what (if anything) is worth exploring.

steps.subject: {COMPANY} LawTech Fatigue...

{{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}, investor expectations
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when your board asks about pipeline for next quarter, what's the answer?

VC-backed companies need predictable growth. We build outbound engines that deliver consistent qualified meetings—quarter over quarter.

How confident is {COMPANY}'s pipeline forecast right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}
Leads That Show

steps.subject: Quick one {FIRST_NAME}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, following up on pipeline predictability.


If {COMPANY}'s growth trajectory already satisfies investor expectations, tell me and I'll close the loop.


But if you'd like to see how we build board-ready pipeline for VC-backed companies—I can send our framework.


Should I send it over, or close the loop?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

Leads That Show

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}, investor expectations
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, building an SDR team burns runway. 6-month ramp, 30% turnover, management overhead—all while investors expect growth now.


We build predictable pipeline engines. No hiring drama. Results in weeks, not quarters.


Has {COMPANY} tried the internal SDR route before?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

Leads That Show

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}, investor expectations
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, "pipeline is strong" isn't a board answer. Numbers are.


We help VC-backed companies build predictable outbound—75+ qualified meetings per quarter, documented and measurable.


What does {COMPANY}'s board expect for pipeline growth this year?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

Leads That Show

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}, investor expectations
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, portfolio companies have 18-24 months to prove growth. That timeline doesn't allow for 6-month SDR ramps.


We build pipeline engines that launch in 14-21 days. 75+ qualified meetings, 80%+ show rates.


What's {COMPANY}'s timeline to hit next growth milestone?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

Leads That Show

steps.subject: {{Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question, {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|{COMPANY} - question|Re: {COMPANY}}}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the content bottleneck
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most content leaders don't say out loud:

Simple updates require dev tickets. Campaign launches wait for IT resources. And by the time your content goes live, the moment's passed.

That's not a content problem. That's a process problem.

We specialize in unbottlenecking content pipelines so your team can launch independently.

How many dev tickets does {COMPANY}'s content team submit per week?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the ticket queue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how many developer tickets does your content team submit per week?

If the answer is "too many," you're not alone. Most Optimizely teams are bottlenecked by IT dependencies for updates that should be self-service.

We help content teams reclaim control without breaking governance.

Want me to send over a content independence checklist? Takes 10 minutes to score your current state.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - missed windows
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, how many campaigns have launched late because content updates got stuck in the dev queue?

Market windows don't wait. Your competitors with faster content operations are capturing the opportunities you're missing.

We've helped content teams cut their IT dependency dramatically.

What's the average turnaround time for a simple content update at {COMPANY} right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the experimentation paradox
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, you're sitting on the world's best experimentation platform.

But if your team lacks the process to move from theory to execution, that capability is just potential energy. Untapped. Unmeasured.

We've launched high-velocity experimentation programs that deliver measurable conversion and revenue lifts.

How many A/B tests did {COMPANY} run last quarter?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - from theory to tests
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, most marketing teams know they should be running more experiments.

The problem isn't belief. It's execution. Building the process, training the team, sustaining velocity.

We've helped Optimizely users go from ad-hoc testing to systematic experimentation programs.

If I sent over our experimentation readiness scorecard, would you take 15 minutes to benchmark {COMPANY}?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - untested revenue
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, every page, flow, and experience you haven't tested is revenue you haven't optimized.

The data's clear: teams that experiment systematically outperform those that guess.

You have the platform. The question is whether you have the process.

What's stopping {COMPANY} from running more experiments right now—resources, process, or something else?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - your Opal credits
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most Optimizely users don't realize:

You have Opal AI credits sitting unused every month. Features that could transform your content operations—untouched.

The top 1% of users engage with Opal nearly 200 times. Most barely scratch the surface.

We help content teams activate Opal with the right foundation.

How many Opal AI actions did {COMPANY} run last month—ballpark?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI without a foundation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, there's pressure to adopt AI for personalization. But without a solid content foundation, you risk investing in technology that delivers no measurable results.

AI is only as good as what it's built on.

We help content teams activate Optimizely's AI features with the right prerequisites in place.

What's {COMPANY}'s biggest blocker to getting more value from Opal right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - AI beyond the buzzword
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, everyone's talking about AI. Few are extracting real value.

The difference? A content strategy that makes AI actionable, not just aspirational.

We've helped content teams turn Opal from feature to revenue driver.

Want me to send over our Opal activation checklist? Shows the 5 prerequisites most teams miss.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 60-90 days
steps.body:

We got them live in 60-90 days.

Same platform. Different approach. The result? They stopped losing to more agile competitors.

How long does it typically take {COMPANY} to launch a new site or major campaign?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the agility gap
steps.body:

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the 80% problem
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's something most IT leaders suspect but rarely quantify:

80% of your Optimizely features are sitting unused. That's not a guess—it's what the data shows across enterprise software.

The result? ROI justification becomes nearly impossible. And the features you're paying for? Your team doesn't even know they exist.

We run complimentary adoption audits for Optimizely users—takes 30 minutes, shows exactly what's being missed.

What's the biggest capability gap you suspect {COMPANY} has right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the ROI question
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when leadership asks about ROI on your Optimizely investment, what do you tell them?

If you're using 20% of the platform's capabilities, the honest answer is uncomfortable. You're paying for value you're not extracting.

We helped Old National Bank benchmark their actual usage and unlock features they didn't know existed.

If I sent over a complimentary audit framework from Optimizely's Partner of the Year, would you take 15 minutes to see where {COMPANY} stands?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the blind spot
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, here's the pattern we see with Optimizely teams:

They know they're underutilizing the platform. They just don't know what they're missing.

No one's mapped feature usage against what's available. So the capabilities that could transform your digital operations sit there, untouched.

We've built an adoption audit that reveals the gaps in under 30 minutes.

Which Optimizely feature do you suspect {COMPANY} should be using but isn't?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the compliance clock
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if {COMPANY}'s running an older Optimizely version, you're likely carrying security vulnerabilities that create regulatory exposure every day you delay.

Not a scare tactic. Just what happens when platforms age faster than upgrade cycles.

We've architected migration paths for enterprises that need to move without disrupting operations.

Can I send you a 5-point security checklist we use with regulated clients? Takes 10 minutes to score yourself.

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 60% to 90%
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we took City of Gresham from 60% to over 90% WCAG AA compliance—and they've maintained it for 10+ years.

Most organizations chase compliance reactively. Constant fire drills. Last-minute scrambles before audits.

There's a better model: proactive compliance built into your platform operations.

Where does {COMPANY} currently sit on WCAG compliance—reactive mode or proactive?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - audit season
steps.body:

If I shared our compliance audit checklist, would it be useful for {COMPANY}'s next review cycle?

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the CMS 12 conversation
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, your CMS 12 upgrade involves major .NET changes that tend to create two problems:

Downtime you didn't budget for. And friction between IT and Marketing you didn't expect.

Our 10+ specialized Optimizely developers have managed 125+ upgrades. The common thread? Planning that prevents the drama.

What's the biggest concern you have about {COMPANY}'s upgrade timeline?

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - 125 upgrades later
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we've done 125+ Optimizely upgrades.

Here's what we've learned: the teams that struggle aren't under-skilled. They're under-prepared. They don't have a migration path that accounts for their specific integrations, content structure, and stakeholder dynamics.

We've built a pre-upgrade readiness assessment that catches the issues before they become problems.

Should I send it over? Takes about 20 minutes to complete.

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - the upgrade friction
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, platform upgrades have a way of surfacing tension between IT and Marketing.

IT wants stability. Marketing wants speed. And somewhere in the middle, your upgrade timeline gets caught.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could launch your MVP in 4-6 weeks instead of 6 months, with production-ready architecture from day one, would you be available to a quick conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We've built MVPs for GoDaddy, IBM, and 120+ companies — they launched in weeks, not months, with no rewrites needed after launch.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could build your MVP with clean, maintainable code that any team can continue after us (no vendor lock-in), would that be worth exploring?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We deliver clean structure, full documentation, and complete ownership — your team or any other dev shop can take over seamlessly.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could deliver your MVP with a predictable budget and clear scope (no surprises), would you be available to a 15-minute conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We provide full transparency — you always know what you're paying for, what's being built, and what's next.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if your no-code tool (Bubble, Webflow, Adalo) is hitting its limits and you need a real MVP that scales, would you be available to discussing how we can help?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We specialize in migrating startups from no-code prototypes to production-ready MVPs — quick, clean, and scalable.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could build your MVP and assure 12 months of post-launch support (stability, bug fixes, improvements), would that be worth a conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We don't disappear after launch — we stay accountable for stability and improvements as real users come in.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could build your MVP with production-ready architecture (no rewrites needed when you scale), would you be available to a quick conversation?

{FIRST_NAME}, if your no-code tool (Bubble, Webflow, Adalo) is hitting its limits and you need a real MVP that scales, would you be available to discussing how we can help?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We specialize in migrating startups from no-code prototypes to production-ready MVPs — quick, clean, and scalable.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could build your MVP and assure 12 months of post-launch support (stability, bug fixes, improvements), would that be worth a conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We don't disappear after launch — we stay accountable for stability and improvements as real users come in.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could build your MVP with production-ready architecture (no rewrites needed when you scale), would you be available to a quick conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We build MVPs that scale from day one — no "throwaway code," no expensive rewrites when you secure traction.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could build your mobile MVP to pass App Store and Google Play reviews on the first try (no rejections, no delays), would that be worth exploring?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We've launched 120+ mobile apps that passed store reviews first time — we know what reviewers look for.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if you could work with the same engineers trusted by GoDaddy, IBM, and Cydome to build your MVP, would that be worth a conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We've built MVPs for 120+ companies including GoDaddy, IBM, Cydome, and H24 — fully production-ready, each launched in weeks.

steps.subject: {Quick question, {FIRST_NAME}|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} - quick question|RE: {FIRST_NAME}}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, if we could build your MVP with flexible architecture that scales as you grow (no uptime issues, no rewrites), would you be available to discussing this?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. We build MVPs with flexible architecture from day one — when you gain traction, your product scales without breaking.

steps.subject: RE: {FIRST_NAME}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we recently helped Cydome, a cybersecurity provider, reduce overhead by 78k/year by implementing our AI solution.


{Want me to send how this would look for {COMPANY}?|Shall I work you through our framework for {COMPANY}?}

steps.subject: FW: {FIRST_NAME}: 15 minutes
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, we recently helped Cydome, a cybersecurity provider, reduce overhead by 78k/year by implementing our AI solution.


If you're around for 15 minutes this week, we'll show you:

- How we reduced Cydome's security ops expenses by 65 percent (and how we'd do the same for {COMPANY})

- The exact workflow areas we automated to cut their team from 15 to 6 analysts

- Your implementation timeline and ROI projection for the first 90 days


You'll walk away with a complete automation roadmap whether we work together or not.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: Re: {{FIRST_NAME} question|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} correct?}

steps.subject: Re: {{FIRST_NAME} question|Question {FIRST_NAME}|{FIRST_NAME} correct?}
steps.body:

If your security ops expenses are similar to other cybersecurity firms your size, you're likely spending 90-120K/year on manual monitoring and compliance work.


Cydome was at 120K. We got them to 42K (65 percent reduction).


If you're around for 15 minutes this week, I'll show you:

- Your estimated current spend vs. what it could be

- The 3 highest-ROI automation areas for your team

- Your payback timeline (Cydome's was under 2 months)


You'll walk away with a ROI breakdown.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - If we don't deliver more value than our project fee, we return the difference

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME} - content infrastructure at {COMPANY}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME},


For media executives, content is the product. The infrastructure that manages and delivers it either enables competitive advantage or creates operational drag.


Most media companies have accumulated content systems over years - editorial tools, distribution pipelines, platform-specific solutions. Each solved a problem. Together, they create complexity that slows everything down.


Hygraph consolidates that. One content platform serving every distribution channel. Operational efficiency without sacrificing editorial flexibility. Architecture that scales with content growth.


Worth a strategic conversation?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - Happy to share how media companies at your scale have approached this consolidation.

Hygraph addresses this at the infrastructure level. One content layer, every platform, streamlined operations.

{FIRST_NAME}, getting flooded with LawTech vendor emails lately?


Most in-house teams at {COMPANY}-sized firms waste hours sorting through 6,000+ solutions. If you're around for 15 minutes this week, we'll show you:


- Which 5-10 LawTech tools actually make sense for your team size and workflow

- What's working (and flopping) for similar in-house teams in {INDUSTRY}

- Red flags to stay away from when vendors pitch you


You'll walk away with a clear market map whether we work together or not.


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - No pitch, no fee. Just 15 minutes to cut through the noise.

steps.subject: Sick of LawTech pitches {FIRST_NAME}?

{FIRST_NAME}, drowning in LawTech vendor pitches?


You don't have time to evaluate 6,000 solutions while juggling corporate, employment, contracts, and everything else. If you're around for 15 minutes next week, we'll show you:


- The 3 most common vendor traps in-house teams fall into (and how to stay away from them)

- What peer companies in {INDUSTRY} are actually using (vs. what vendors claim)

- A no-pressure roadmap for evaluating tools when you're ready


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}


P.S. - We're not selling software. We help you figure out what's worth exploring.

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}, investor expectations
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, when your board asks about pipeline for next quarter, what's the answer?

VC-backed companies need predictable growth. We build outbound engines that deliver consistent qualified meetings—quarter over quarter.

How confident is {COMPANY}'s pipeline forecast right now?

{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}
Leads That Show

steps.subject: Quick one {FIRST_NAME}
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, following up on pipeline predictability.


If {COMPANY}'s growth trajectory already satisfies investor expectations, tell me and I'll close the loop.


But if you'd like to see how we build board-ready pipeline for VC-backed companies—I can send our framework.


Should I send it over, or close the loop?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

Leads That Show

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}, investor expectations
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, building an SDR team burns runway. 6-month ramp, 30% turnover, management overhead—all while investors expect growth now.


We build predictable pipeline engines. No hiring drama. Results in weeks, not quarters.


Has {COMPANY} tried the internal SDR route before?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

Leads That Show

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}, investor expectations
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, "pipeline is strong" isn't a board answer. Numbers are.


We help VC-backed companies build predictable outbound—75+ qualified meetings per quarter, documented and measurable.


What does {COMPANY}'s board expect for pipeline growth this year?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

Leads That Show

steps.subject: {FIRST_NAME}, investor expectations
steps.body:
{FIRST_NAME}, portfolio companies have 18-24 months to prove growth. That timeline doesn't allow for 6-month SDR ramps.


We build pipeline engines that launch in 14-21 days. 75+ qualified meetings, 80%+ show rates.


What's {COMPANY}'s timeline to hit next growth milestone?


{SENDER_EMAIL_SIGNATURE}

Leads That Show
